Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/27/2017
First and foremost, you're paying over $1000 for a two bedroom that does not have no washer and dryer, heat barely works, hot water doesn't stay hot for more than 10 minutes, tiny bugs will come visit you, and maintence will walk into your apartment without knocking. Two weeks ago I got my rental car towed. I went up to the lady that works at front desk to tell her about the incident and she literally told me there's nothing she can do about it. I asked to speak with a manager that gave me my temporary pass for my rental and she told me I can't speak with her because she's away on vacation. I asked her if I could get the persons contact information that is in charge when she's not available and she told me, "No, I will have someone call you" I asked her if she could make that phone call in front of me and she told me no because she was too busy. I was standing right in front of her, no customers were in there waiting to see her, my problems were important and she treated it like it was nothing. I never in a million years would think anyone that has a career as an receptionist would have a terrible attitude the way she did. I will never live here again. I'm giving my hard working money to an apartment complex that doesn't give a ---- about you.

Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/24/2017
I am happy to call independence Park my home. I have lived here for 2 years and have a feeling it will be longer. I feel very safe with the security guard making his rounds all night. My neighbors are all so friendly everyone says hello and gives wishes for a good day and night. Maintenance usually come the same day to resolve any problem I might have. The management, Jamie and Heather are on point. They even called me after hours because there was a package I had been waiting for. The new face lift is beautiful. The pool and the gym are both relaxing and very clean. I can't imagine living any place else. THERE'S NO PLACE LIKE HOME!

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/14/2017
I have been living here for a few weeks now and absolutely love it. The staff is amazing. They have always been very kind and patient with me no matter how many questions I ask or how many times I stop into the office. My apartment looked like new when I moved in. Very neat and clean. So refreshing compared to the numerous others I had checked out before coming to Independence Park. And I feel very safe here. The grounds are very well lit, giving me an extra sense of security knowing there is "on campus" security patrolling the grounds. For the most part my apartment has been very quiet as well. Coming from having only lived in houses where neighbors were across the street I have had to adjust to having someone living overhead. But that is minor and has not been an issue. I highly recommend these apartments.

2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/17/2016
I've lived at Independence Park Apartments since January 2016 and am very happy to call it home. I brought with me a large breed dog which was welcomed with open arms almost immediately by both adults and small children. The staff and the tenants are incredibly friendly and willing to assist with anything I may need. The maintenance staff is awesome. Response time has typically been less than a few hours. The walking trail around the pond is great. Peaceful and relaxing. And while I prefer walking outdoors, the property features an ample gym. Overall, a wonderful place to live.

Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/27/2016
Great place to live! Jamie made the application process very easy and my apartment was clean and ready for move in as scheduled. The 1 bedroom apartment is very specious with plenty of closet space. I especially like the sunroom, which I made into an office space with large plants (big window with plenty of light) and chaise chair to relax. Also kitchen has generous counter top space and bar which can easily fit 4 people. The entire complex is kept very clean and well maintained. There is no problems with noise and all my neighbors are very polite folks. I can't stress enough that staff is extremely helpful and incredibly pleasant. Every time I show up in the leasing office, I am greeted with a smile. They are happy to answer questions and wiling to get out of their way to help out. There is never a wrong time and they never leave you with a impression that you are a bother. That's even true when I shipped big and heavy boxes with furniture to the leasing office during the move-in period :) Also, I really like the location of complex. It is a nice oasis to get away from the busy life around the Duke Hospital where I work. At the same time it is conveniently located within 10-15 minutes of Duke and Downtown Durham, and less than 10 min from I-85. Close location to grocery stores, banks, and multiple restaurants.

Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/30/2016
I recently moved into Independence Park Apartments and have nothing but wonderful things to say about the property. In particular, it has been a pleasure to get to know Jamie, the property manager, as well as Breanna. Both employees deliver excellent customer service that ensures all problems and concerns are resolved quickly and efficiently. Although I haven't had any issues with the property, I know that the staff at Independence Park is a phone call away to take care of anything that may come up. The property itself is a great place for both families and single people to live. I live in a complex with many families and have never had an issue once with noise. Overall a very CLEAN, extremely well kept and welcoming environment, especially for the PRICE in Durham. You can't get any better than Independence Park, folks!

Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/27/2016
I've lived here for two years. In that time, we've switched management. I have never had an issue with maintenance and the men that make fixtures around the apartment complex. However, I have had issues with the office staff. Passive aggressive talk on the phone, lying about pest control coming to the apartment, and just being nonchalant about their job. I called the office because I notice small black bugs and wanted pest control to come to the unit. She said he'd be by on Tuesday the next week. I changed my schedule and stayed at home the entire day to meet him and no one showed. I called the office again the next day and she flat out lied and said he had came and that maybe I wasn't in my right mental capacity. I'm a 29 year old ICU nurse. I'm confident she is a liar and full of crap. The apartment grounds have been littered with trash, and no one seems to be cleaning it up. I've been picking up trash that has been placed by my apartment for puver 6 months now, and all the apartment manager can say is we can't do anything about it until we know who is doing it. Lies. They can start cleaning it up no matter who it is. I never had bugs until a couple months ago when both the upstairs and downstairs tenants left.. So, in conclusion, I'm leaving.

I really like living here! The apartments are newly renovated from older buildings, but for the most part they did a really nice job. All the appliances are in great shape and the carpet is nice. Importantly for me, the kitchens are HUGE, which is great and hard to find in an apartment. The office staff is also incredibly nice; many of them live on-site, so they make sure the grounds stay well-maintained. My only problem (and it's not a big one) is that the front doors are not very soundproof. If people are loud in the hallways (I happen to have loud neighbors across the hall), you can hear it all in the living room, but you can't hear it once you move to the bedrooms, and the walls are nice and thick. I am definitely glad to live here.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/26/2016
We lived here for two years. In all fairness, the first year was OK. It was a nice complex. The management was friendly and responsive. The location is great. A little over a year later, we started noticing differences such as people leaving their trash out in front of their apartment doors for days at a time. Someone left their trash on top of the hood of their car for multiple days. There is a fenced area near us that people used to dump trash. When we walked around the complex it was not unusual to see litter including beer cans and fast food containers. Shopping carts parked on curbs (we've seen this twice), theft (one of our bicycles was stolen), and situations involving the police were noted. One night there were several police vehicles outside of our apartment. The next morning we noticed a door had apparently been kicked in. It was left in two pieces in front of the fence where people drop off their trash (not a designated trash disposal area). It stayed there for many days. We also had mold/mildew in our apartment. It was on walls, blinds, in closets, under the bed, in a dresser, in a nightstand, on shoes, clothes, and handbags. We reported the mold/mildew issue to the Durham Neighborhood Improvement Services Department twice. The inspectors found the complex in violation (Housing- Responsibility of Owners, Durham City Code Chpt 10, Art VI: Violation #1: 10-237(c) Shared or public areas are not maintained in a clean or sanitary condition...(As documented in a hearing noticed dated 12/17/2015). There was a hearing on 12/30/15. No one showed up but my husband and I. It is our understanding that the mold/mildew issue is not isolated to the unit in which we lived. If you experience any issue with mold/mildew, maintenance will come to the apartment and clean it off the walls, window areas, and blinds. Be sure to check closets, under the bed, in corners, behind headboards, and other places you may not normally look. Pay attention to bedrooms used primarily for storage. The mold/mildew was not isolated to exterior walls and in our apartment as we discovered during the moving process. It is important to note this was a recurring issue for us. Maintenance would clean it and it would return, especially after it rained. The Durham Neighborhood Improvement Services Department (http://durhamnc.gov/570/Neighborhood-Improvement-Services) is very responsive and can be reached at 919-560-1647, ext. 34281. We were told they conduct investigations on a case by case basis. They will investigate any reports they receive. We also had an issue with water from the apartment above us seeping into our living room. The section of our carpet near the pipe in the wall connecting us with the upstairs apartment was wet. When maintenance came to our apartment, we were told the water was coming from the air conditioning unit. They brought in a large fan to blow air under the carpet to dry it. The water didn't dry up. We went out of town and when we came back that section of carpet was soaked. Whenever the people above us flushed their toilet, water leaked into our living room. It was determined the water was not coming from the air conditional unit. It was raw sewage. Management ultimately cut open the wall and fixed the problem. We stayed in another apartment on-site while that was done at no additional cost to us. We were very appreciative. Other buildings may be fine. We cannot speak for other units, but can provide factual information about what we witnessed and experience. The pictures posted are a small sample of the pictures taken to support the accuracy and reliability of this review. The mold/mildew issue is documented and reported.

On several occasions I have had the pleasure of dealing with our properties Assistant Manager " Jamie ". Each time she has met my needs with the same level of courtesy and professionalism. I do and will continue to recommend this community to everyone that I encounter that is looking for an apartment home in the Nortern Durham area!!!!

Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/30/2015
This place has been great. My girlfriend has lived here for the past 4 years, and when the time came for me to start looking for a place, this became the perfect fit. I was renting a house with some other guys and the owner decided he wanted to list the house again. We had initially gotten to rent the house because it had been on the market so long without selling. We agreed thinking we'd have plenty of time before someone bought it. Turns out a ton of people were interested and instead of the July move data that I was planning, I needed a move date in May. After looking at several places (and a slight timeline miscommunication with the owner of the house), I was up against a short deadline. My girlfriend and I decided to get a 2 bedroom here over a couple houses and downtown apartments we had also checked out. In addition to being very easy to work with on getting the lease set up, Angie, Jamie, and team were also super responsive to my need for a quick setup in the new space. Our apartment has a great layout, is in the building we wanted, and is almost 2x as large as the one we looked at in downtown for roughly 60% of the price. Since moving in, I have placed a handful of service requests from "my disposal is clogged" to "there are ants crawling in under my door!" all but one of which have been handled promptly and efficiently. Honestly, my only complaint about this place really has nothing to do with the staff or with the building, but with some of the other residents. I know that we have a new trash compactor and it used to be just a dumpster you tossed your trash into not that long ago. But for some reason, some residents just keep throwing their trash on top of the compactor instead of using the door. While this may seem like a minor thing, we are one of two buildings close to the compactor and when it was hot outside mid summer and people were doing this, you could smell it when the wind blew. On hot days with no trash on the compactor, no smell at all. TL;DR - Great place, great staff, residents do dumb things sometimes but not a major detractor from the overall good stuff.

Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/20/2015
I have lived at Independence Park Apartments since June 2015 and my experience has been extremely positive. First, I found a great apartment in a convenient location at a great price. Located near an elementary/ high school and several medical office buildings, it is an ideal location. The demographics of the residents is diverse and everyone seems friendly enough. The office staff are especially friendly and helpful, holding packages in the office if you are not home to sign for them. The grounds are well-kept and quiet. The fitness center is modern, spacious, and clean. The theater room is great for having friends over. The car care center is covered and convenient. I live on the first floor, and I can hear my neighbors above me at times, but I don't mind. I do not hear my neighbor beside me at all. Overall, I am very happy with my experience and consider Independence Park to be one of the best kept secrets in Durham. I just want to update my review as of 01/29/17. Independence Park is still one of the best kept secrets in Durham, NC. Jamie and her management team are professional, friendly, extremely helpful, and maintenance requests are taken care of within 24-48 hours.

Excellent place to live. Very good apartments, pretty new. The condominium has a good swimming pool, gym, tennis court, and some places to make a barbecue. There is a very sympathetic small lake inside the complex where it is possible to see some birds every day. Good neighborhood, quite, but not too far from downtown. I am a Duke student and I would especially recommend this place for other Duke students who doen't need to be in a walking distance to the campus. 2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/05/2015
I am currently living in Independence Park and I am not enjoying it very much.Dont move here. I liked the fact that it was a very diverse community when I first moved here ,but that is quickly changing and not for the best. I am starting to wonder just how much section 8 is over here. Parents cant pay this much money and not care about the property.My advice is move somewhere else its ghetto.Many of the old tenants are leaving. I recently had a friend come by; she saw some of the the same things that I am complaining about and asked me if this was the hood. It certainly is starting to look like it.The apartments are very nice but management needs to improve alot of things. First of all there is always trash on the grounds and in the breezeways. The stairs are filthy and there are cracks in some of the siding. Its been that way for a while and they have not fixed it. The rails need painting; cobwebs need to be removed. Grease stains are in the breeze ways it looks horrible. A little degreaser could fix that. The buildings need pressure washing. Maintance will fix things in a timely fashion but not necessarily to your satisfaction the first time. It is becoming very ghetto examples are as folllows people sitting on the steps. Teens writing on the property. Kids drawing on the side walks and leaving trash on the steps and at the steps daily. The kids are not monitored and they are constantly using loud profane language, and being destructive to property. Some of the teens wont move out of your way as you try to come up the sidewalk.The kids are swinging on tennis and volley ball nets,jumping on the bushes. Some of the parents see the children doing things and say nothing. I dont allow my kids to come out thats how bad it is. I am not naming everything that I see.The kids are always on the computer in the internet cafe so you can barely get a computer if you need one. Management looks the other way and is doing nothing. They are okay but sometimes they act as if you are bothering them when you come into the office. Kindness goes a long way. There are no community meetings, and there are no activities for adults or kids. Management could do more to bring the apartments back up to the old standards. Think twice before moving here. By the way my rent is always on time and I have no personal problems with the staff. I am just telling you whats going on here.

I've toured this property several times during my decision making process and am very pleased with the apartment home. I viewed the model (those are always awesome) and a vacant apartment. The vacant apartment looked just like the model! Well, the carpet was slightly different in color but no big deal about that. The staff members that I've worked with are always very respectful and helpful. I ask a lot of questions and was never made to feel like I was bothering them. I felt totally comfortable with them and appreciated their patience. Choosing an apartment is an important decision and I felt the staff members cared about meeting my individual needs. I've talked with Erin, Robin, Pela? (not sure how to spell it), and two weekend staff members. The maintenance man even greeted me with a cheerful hello one morning. So I've read all the previous posts about crime concerns and this had me a little nervous. I've driven through the neighborhood at all times of day and night. From 7am in the morning, 8 or 9 at night, to 1 or 2 am. I have personally seen security patrolling the property in his vehicle. This occured the majority of the nights that I've driven through. I was informed by staff members that there are also off duty police officers who are available as well. I've done this for several weeks and it appears to me that managment is now taking steps to make sure residents are safe. This was my only concern about the property, because those previous review were pretty tough. Oh yea, and the grounds are extremely neat and clean. I love how they hide the dumpster. Ok well not hide, but its behind a fence. There is no trash hanging out everywhere like at other places. The entry ways and stairwells are also well maintained. That may not mean a lot to some but it does to me. From what I can tell it looks like there is ample parking too!

From 7am in the morning, 8 or 9 at night, to 1 or 2 am. I have personally seen security patrolling the property in his vehicle. This occured the majority of the nights that I've driven through. I was informed by staff members that there are also off duty police officers who are available as well. I've done this for several weeks and it appears to me that managment is now taking steps to make sure residents are safe. This was my only concern about the property, because those previous review were pretty tough. Oh yea, and the grounds are extremely neat and clean. I love how they hide the dumpster. Ok well not hide, but its behind a fence. There is no trash hanging out everywhere like at other places. The entry ways and stairwells are also well maintained. That may not mean a lot to some but it does to me. From what I can tell it looks like there is ample parking too! Read less

Report
Resident
0 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/27/2011
During the past year, residents at Independence Park have been plagued with an excessive number of burglaries, robberies, carjacking, and vandalism. More than 25 residents met with law enforcement officers in October 2011 to discuss safety concerns at Independence Park. Management DID NOT attend the meeting. Residents communicated numerous horror stories of the effect the burglaries, robberies, and vandalism had on their families. Some residents were clueless to the high rate of criminal activity at Independence Park. The Durham Police Department maintains statistics for the area. As a resident, I am presently unaware of the new management scheduling a meeting with the residents to discuss the many concerns within the community. Providing hot baked cookies to residents and potential residents in the office building is an insignificant gesture compared to safety and security. Trust is developed by the building of community relations with the residents which is enhanced through regular community meetings. Until meaningful community relation is directly established between management and the residents, Independence Park has the potential to become one of the most undesirable communities in Durham. This is unfortunate due to numerous professionals working in the immediate area in the fields of health care/medical, banking, fast food, restaurant, education, home improvement, government, and law enforcement. If ongoing concerns persist at Independence Park related to safety and security that are not discussed via community meetings between management, residents, and law enforcement, residents and potential residents especially professionals will select a safer alternative to reside. Some concerns are: 1) Posting notices/flyers on resident's doors. Some residents work different shifts, long hours, and out of town. Notices left on the door alert criminals that no one is home. This is similar to newspapers accumulating in a neighbor's driveway. 2) Adolescents and adults from the surrounding area are constantly using the basketball court and observing residents. This potentially contributes to crime at Independence Park. 3) Non-residents are observed in the computer and workout areas. This is a concern especially for adolescent and female residents who utilize the areas at night. 4) Non-residents are observed dumping their garbage and broken furniture at the on-site waste management hub. The waste management containers during the weekend are often overflowing, smelly, and unsafe for residents who attempt to discard their trash. 5) Non-residents are using the on-site car wash and observing residents. 6) Adolescents and adults from the adjacent neighborhoods are observed walking through the apartment buildings and exiting through the woods and other trails. Again, this potentially contribute to the crime rate at Independence Park. Independence Park is located within walking distance of one of the poorest neighborhoods in Durham. Community relations and communication are a necessity between management, the residents, and law enforcement through regularly scheduled community meetings. Hopefully, a resident does not have to be assaulted, raped, or murdered at Independence Park by outsiders before there are community meetings to openly discuss concerns. There is a need for on-site security which reduces the chances of a volatile/physical situation if a resident confronts and/or questions an outsider/non-resident. The apartments are spacious with energy efficient appliances. However, privacy within the apartment is moderate. The neighbor's dogs can be overheard barking and pets running throughout the apartment. The neighbors can be overheard watching TV, using their washing machine, snoring and engaging in intimate relations. A neighbor and I shared a similar work schedule. In the morning, she could be overheard urinating, defecating, flatulating, taking a shower, and using her portable tooth brush. It was uncomfortable overhearing her and I often cringed when meeting her in the corridor. Another neighbor engaged in domestic abuse and violence with his companion. The Durham Police arrived at his apartment one morning while he was asleep with a warrant. The resident did not respond to the Police knocking on his door. The Police approached me to confirm the resident was present in the apartment directly above. The resident was overheard snoring and the Police remained at the door knocking until he finally responded. Another resident described the 'neighbor from hell' after the Durham Police was called regarding a confrontation between neighbors. The neighbor downstairs complained that the little child in the above apartment made too much noise playing. The Durham Police was called to intervene and diffuse the situation. The neighbor upstairs moved to a downstairs apartment where the child could freely play and to avoid further confrontation. There is a fee associated with switching units. A former Independence Park maintenance worker alerted some of the residents of the building of alleged crack/cocaine he observed on the table in the apartment of a resident while completing a maintenance request. Yet, another neighbor described the smell of marijuana being smoked near the corridor of his building. The mobile phone reception is minimal inside some units and residents are observed and overheard outside using their mobile phones. Lastly, residents are observed allowing their pets to urinate and defecate next to the apartment buildings. The most DISGUSTING thing is some residents NEVER pick up the fecal waste. It accumulates and people inadvertently step in it. This is the reality of living at Independence Park until my lease expires.

The apartments are gorgeous and it appears they offer a lot of nice deals. I have applied to this complex and although I'm not sure if I'm in yet, the management team welcomed me with positive attitudes and encouraged my visit to the office for any future questions or concerns. I have visited the complex at night to observe the atmosphere and look for any questionable activity. I am pleased to say the complex was well lit and calm. I have also visited early morning, at which time things also appeared calm with working class individuals about the business of work. The apartment complex exhibits many of the qualities working class individuals with families are looking for; serenity, quality, quantity and security.

Report
Resident
2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/17/2011
I looked for a long time when moving to Durham. Independence Park was the best I found within my budget and seemed to be the safest of the complexes in the area because it's in a medical park and tucked back behind a shopping center. It definitely is pretty safe -- I've never had any issues to date and I've been there almost a year -- but there have been instances of theft. The neighborhood is downtown Durham, so you have to expect some of that to bleed over. The apartment itself is very nice and great for the amount I pay. I have a two-bedroom with a sunroom for less than $900. Couldn't be happier with the apartment itself and with management, whom are very friendly. Some of the downfalls are definitely the noise. There are a ton of kids that live in the complex and they love to run up and down the breezeways screaming bloody murder. I tend to be a quiet, private person, and I am not a fan of how not private this place feels. The kids are rude and invasive. In addition, they leave trash all over the place in common areas. Just to give you an idea, I've found not only pet waste, but two rotten eggs, banana peels and other random trash on the stairs and in the breezeways. They sit there forever and management does not pick that up. I mostly blame the parents for not keeping the kids under control, but the noise and nosiness definitely makes me want to move at times. If you have a pet, the landscaping leaves a lot to be desired, especially when it rains. It seems the grass was all imported, so there's some type of netting on the ground, which makes it extremely difficult for my dog to walk around without getting her nails caught in the netting. The rain also makes the grounds like rice patties for days, which again, makes it difficult for her to do her business. I have used the gym quite often and it is okay. There is always at least one machine that's broken, though. The construction behind the complex is a problem. Every morning, regardless of if it's a weekend or not, those guys are working starting at 6:30AM. I can't stress how much noise is a problem. Overall, the cleanliness and noisiness of the complex could use some serious work and attention, but I am mostly satisfied.

2009 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/16/2011
I love this place and they have taken such good care of us! I moved in right when the 900 building had just been built. I am have lived here with my fianc e. If you do have a pet the pet deposit is VERY expensive at $200.00 non refundable PER pet. Plus you must pay $20 a month per pet also. Mind you this does not cover the damages my dog had made to the blinds from looking out. The dog park is gross but I blame the community for that. It states very clearly to clean up after your pets and the complex provides them with bags and they still don't pick up after their dogs. People here are lazy sadly, not the fault of the complex. I was in a two bedroom and it was ample space for two people. I had a beautiful view of the lake! I shortly moved into a 3 bedroom in one of the older buildings and I still loved it. Plenty of room still and I had a balcony instead of the sunroom. The community here is growing because the all inclusive is awesome!! I can leave my lights on all day and I never see a bill for it! The complex knows me and has always worked out any issues I have had and because they knew I lost my dog far too early...had him for only 7 months. They were very sweet and only had me pay a deposit for one of my cats when I got two kittens. I have now in the 3 bedroom all inclusive. This includes:basic cable, water, electric, washer/dryer, and use of all the amenities for 1300. The faculty will do whatever that is in their power to help you. There is a basketball court that many neighboring kids like to sneak into the and complex is doing whatever they can to get rid of them but even residents make it harder for them. Some residents even messed up the pool one summer by throwing weights from the weight room into the pool. Not the complex fault but of those living there. I have loved every moment here. I think it is a little expensive for pets but great for everything else its great.
I love this place and they have taken such good care of us! I moved in right when the 900 building had just been built. I am have lived here with my fianc e. I had wonderful neighbors that had the best kids. Kids will be kids and scream like always but I only ever heard them was when they were coming home. I never heard anything when they went inside. I had a dog when I moved in and my biggest complaint as a vet tech was the breed specification but I feel that the owner makes the dog not the breed. 2009 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/03/2011
When I first saw the community here, I knew this would be my last move before I decided to buy a house. I moved here in July 2009. I have enjoyed my stay. I have had to email corporate on four separate occasions....each email was responded to and handled in a prompt manner. There is loud noise in the early a.m. hours from people that have no respect for themselves or others. Maintenace requests have always been handled the same day I put them in. This is the first apartment I have ever lived in without any bug problem at all!!!! My only wish is that they could lower the rent since I don't use any of the amenities due to running into the students I teach that live here. I will be moving when my lease is up due to buying a home! Overall, I would give Independence Park a four star rating.

Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/21/2010
We have been living in Independence Park for 3 months now. We were traveling all over the country as my wife is a 14 year RT/RN. Now, due to my clinical situation that turned sour after 2 1/2 years with an online school I am committing to a local community college here in Durham to finish my degree. Now when we first moved into Independence the staff was "all business" with just a touch of warmth. As we have needed touch-up paint or service calls they have been prompt and timely. Now we have to live here for 3 more years. Kris ( I believe he's the manager) has answered any and every question we have asked about a longer term lease. Whenever we need a fax done the staff there has gone out of their way to do it. When getting down to the pricing they have met any low price of neighboring apartments. After our experience lately of preparing to move here full time the management has been very warm, informative and easy to deal with. I can tell they stay pretty busy but they are accommodating and saving us money.

Report
Resident
2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/22/2010
I completely agree with the statement "everything that glitters is not gold." This apartment was a great apartment when I first moved in 2 years ago. The living areas are nice, they have great amenities, and it's a great location for anyone working in the medical park area. Unfortunately, over the past year or so the management has changed so many times--there has been more staff turnover than tenant turnover!!! This part of Durham is not an ideal place to live at all. This apartment was like a diamond in the rough, so to speak. The biggest thing that attracted me here were the amenities. Unfortunately there are affordable housing communities in the area within walking distance that do not have these amenities. So the kids make themselves right at home at Independence Park! There has been a HIGH traffic volume of people who CLEARLY don't live in this community, especially in the spring and summer. (This traffic easily makes the neighborhood look and feel like the "projects.") The management does little to nothing about it, partially because it's difficult and partially because I find it hard to believe they even care (hell, it's not their community, and the rent is being paid anyway.) Sometimes I wonder if this is a private neighborhood or an extension of the YMCA... This neighborhood is not completely ruined yet, but it is headed that way VERY FAST. Unless something changes, my bets are that this apartment will turn into affordable housing (aka section 8) within 3 - 5 years. I just can't see decent, hardworking people like myself continuing to pay such high rent for a community that feels like the "projects" at times. And more people like myself will move out and go some place else that WILL maintain a professional and respectable community. In the meantime, I will NOT be resigning another lease with Independence Park.
